name: Yeronga
description: Fairfield, Yeronga, and Yeerongpilly are three suburbs located just south of the City and offer a homey, residential community, with access to the City and beyond via good public transport and roadways. The mainly residential suburbs are centrally located for anyone at the St Lucia campus or looking for close proximity to West End, the Princess Alexandra Hospital, and various schools and parks.

Popular with young professionals and families, these suburbs have a great variety of housing options, primarily in the form of Queenslander-style houses; though small unit blocks can be found. Shared accommodation costs approximately $140 per week, while individual properties average approximately $460 per week. Costs can vary depending on property size, location, and type.

Public transport in the area is plentiful with plenty of buses, access to trains and the ferries nearby. Each of the three suburbs have their own train station and have buses operating throughout to the City, neighbouring suburbs, and the UQ St Lucia campus.

The closest shopping centre, Fairfield Gardens, offers a wide range of shops including a supermarket, café’s, a chemist, and banks. Smaller, local shops can be found all along Ipswich Road, a major roadway through the three suburbs.

In addition to the close proximity to the conveniences of the City, there are also many parks, walkways, bike paths and other recreational areas. You can catch a soccer match at Goodwin Park, gain access to the river via the Yeronga Rowing Club, or go for a round of golf at the Brisbane Golf Club.
strapline: See the Olympic Football Club play at Goodwin Park!
transport: Buses are frequent and each suburb has their own train station with access to the City and other parts south.
shopping: Shopping at the Fairfield Gardens Shopping Centre is a breeze or you can visit some of the smaller, local shops on Ipswich Road.
cost: The many Queenslander-style homes mean this area is great for sharehouses or families looking for their own space.
social: Small restaurants and pubs line the main streets here. There’s also plenty of access via public transport to West End and the City.
